adrFormatAddress: 1614 York Ave, New York, NY 10028-6257, USA

originalText.text: Jamie has been working with our son for the past nine months and we have seen astonishing improvement in his speech. I am delighted with the work she is doing with him. My son is eager to attend the sessions and genuinely enjoys learning with Jamie. I cannot recommend her highly enough.

text.text: Jamie has been working with our son for the past nine months and we have seen astonishing improvement in his speech. I am delighted with the work she is doing with him. My son is eager to attend the sessions and genuinely enjoys learning with Jamie. I cannot recommend her highly enough.

originalText.text:
When I visited my grandson in August last year, his speech was limited, very challenging. He’s clearly intelligent enough, no problem there, but somehow he couldn’t make words, just sounds. It was very hard to work out what he was trying to say or what he wanted. And it clearly frustrated him too.

Now I’m visiting again, 10 months later. The progress is remarkable. His school put his parents onto Jamie, and she’s been very effective. For example, he can say the sound ‘sss’ and ‘sh’ words, plus lots, lots more. He now says ‘Grandad’ - last year I was G-G. It’s been continuous diligent therapeutic work (which he clearly enjoys), and there’s still a way to go. But I’m delighted, because good clear communication is essential in life and education. I love seeing him growing and achieving.

originalText.text: We have worked closely with Jamie and our 3 year old for some months, the improvement has been incredible. Jamie is dedicated, intuitive, and passionate about her work. A life-changing experience for us.

text.text: We have worked closely with Jamie and our 3 year old for some months, the improvement has been incredible. Jamie is dedicated, intuitive, and passionate about her work. A life-changing experience for us.

originalText.text: We had 6 speech therapy sessions with a 4 year old, during which Jamie spent about 10% of the time working with the child. The rest of the time she was filling out questionnaires and speaking to us on unrelated topics. She eventually charged us not only for the evaluation (which we happily paid for, as this is an important part of the process), but also for 6 hours of speech therapy, which she didn't provide.
